00084 #include <avr32/io.h>
00085 #include "board.h"
00086 #include "print_funcs.h"
00087 #include "gpio.h"

00089 #include "count.h"
00090 #include "intc.h"
00091 #include "twi.h"

00093 
00094 #define TEST_PATTERN          0x41
00095 #define DEVICE_ADDRESS        0x50
00096 #define PAGE_START_ADDRESS    0
00097 #define NB_BYTES              8 // if EEPROM used, 8 bits max per write cycle
00098 
00099 
00101 volatile unsigned char TimeOut = 0;
00102 
00105 #if __GNUC__
00106 __attribute__((__interrupt__))
00107 #elif __ICCAVR32__
00108 __interrupt
00109 #endif
00110 static void compare_irq_handler(void)
00111 {
00112   TimeOut = 1;
00113   // Disable the compare and exception generation feature: set COMPARE to 0.
00114   Set_sys_compare(0);
00115 }
00116 
00119 void delay_ms(unsigned short time_ms)
00120 {
00121 unsigned long u32CountVal,u32CompareVal;
00122 
00123   TimeOut = 0;
00124 
00125   u32CountVal = Get_sys_count();
00126 
00127   u32CompareVal = u32CountVal + ((unsigned long)time_ms * (FOSC0 / 1000)); // WARNING: MUST FIT IN 32bits.
00128 
00129   Set_sys_compare(u32CompareVal); // GO
00130 
00131   //  The previous COMPARE write succeeded.
00132   // Loop until the COUNT&COMPARE match triggers.
00133   while (!TimeOut);
00134 }
00135 
00136 
00139 int main(void)
00140 {
00141   static const gpio_map_t TWI_GPIO_MAP =
00142   {
00143     {AVR32_TWI_SDA_0_0_PIN, AVR32_TWI_SDA_0_0_FUNCTION},
00144     {AVR32_TWI_SCL_0_0_PIN, AVR32_TWI_SCL_0_0_FUNCTION}
00145   };
00146 
00147   twi_options_t opt;
00148   twi_package_t packet, packet_received;
00149   int status, i;
00150   char data_sent[NB_BYTES];
00151   char data_received[NB_BYTES] = {0};
00152 
00153   // Init data to send
00154   for (i = 0 ; i <= NB_BYTES ; i++)
00155   {
00156     data_sent[i] = TEST_PATTERN + i;
00157   }
00158 
00159   // Switch to oscillator 0
00160   pm_switch_to_osc0(&AVR32_PM, FOSC0, OSC0_STARTUP);
00161 
00162   // Disable all interrupts.
00163   Disable_global_interrupt();
00164 
00165   // Init the interrupt controller
00166   INTC_init_interrupts();
00167 
00168   // Register the compare interrupt handler to the interrupt controller.
00169   INTC_register_interrupt(&compare_irq_handler, AVR32_CORE_COMPARE_IRQ, INT0);
00170 
00171   // Enable all interrupts.
00172   Enable_global_interrupt();
00173 
00174   // Init debug serial line
00175   init_dbg_rs232(FOSC0);
00176 
00177   // Display a header to user
00178   print_dbg("\x1B[2J\x1B[H\r\nTWI Example\r\n");
00179 
00180   // TWI gpio pins configuration
00181   gpio_enable_module(TWI_GPIO_MAP, sizeof(TWI_GPIO_MAP) / sizeof(TWI_GPIO_MAP[0]));
00182 
00183   // options settings
00184   opt.pba_hz = FOSC0;
00185   opt.speed = 50000;
00186   opt.chip = DEVICE_ADDRESS;
00187 
00188   // initialize TWI driver with options
00189   status = twi_init(&AVR32_TWI, &opt);
00190 
00191   // check init result
00192   if (status == TWI_SUCCESS)
00193   {
00194     // display test result to user
00195     print_dbg("Probe test:\tPASS\r\n");
00196   }
00197   else
00198   {
00199     // display test result to user
00200     print_dbg("Probe test:\tFAIL\r\n");
00201   }
00202 
00203   // TWI chip address to communicate with
00204   packet.chip = DEVICE_ADDRESS;
00205   // TWI address/commands to issue to the other chip (node)
00206   packet.addr = PAGE_START_ADDRESS;
00207   // Length of the TWI data address segment (1-3 bytes)
00208   packet.addr_length = 1;
00209   // Where to find the data to be written
00210   packet.buffer = data_sent;
00211   // How many bytes do we want to write
00212   packet.length = NB_BYTES;
00213 
00214   // perform a write access
00215   status = twi_master_write(&AVR32_TWI, &packet);
00216 
00217   // check write result
00218   if (status == TWI_SUCCESS)
00219   {
00220     // display test result to user
00221     print_dbg("Write test:\tPASS\r\n");
00222   }
00223   else
00224   {
00225     // display test result to user
00226     print_dbg("Write test:\tFAIL\r\n");
00227   }
00228 
00229   // Accessing an EEPROM needs a guard time for bytes writing
00230   for (i = 0 ; i <= NB_BYTES ; i++)
00231   {
00232     delay_ms(7);
00233   }
00234 
00235   // TWI chip address to communicate with
00236   packet_received.chip = DEVICE_ADDRESS ;
00237   // Length of the TWI data address segment (1-3 bytes)
00238   packet_received.addr_length = 1;
00239   // How many bytes do we want to write
00240   packet_received.length = NB_BYTES;
00241   // TWI address/commands to issue to the other chip (node)
00242   packet_received.addr = PAGE_START_ADDRESS;
00243   // Where to find the data to be written
00244   packet_received.buffer = data_received;
00245 
00246   // perform a read access
00247   status = twi_master_read(&AVR32_TWI, &packet_received);
00248 
00249   // check read result
00250   if (status == TWI_SUCCESS)
00251   {
00252     // display test result to user
00253     print_dbg("Read Test:\tPASS\r\n");
00254   }
00255   else
00256   {
00257     // display test result to user
00258     print_dbg("Read test:\tFAIL\r\n");
00259   }
00260 
00261   // check received data against sent data
00262   for (i = 0 ; i < NB_BYTES ; i++)
00263   {
00264     if (packet_received.buffer[i] != packet.buffer[i])
00265     {
00266       // a char isn't consistent
00267       print_dbg("Check Read:\tFAIL\r\n");
00268       // Error
00269       while(1);
00270     }
00271   }
00272 
00273   // everything was OK
00274   print_dbg("Check Read:\tPASS\r\n");
00275   while(1)
00276   {
00277     // LED OK blinks
00278     gpio_tgl_gpio_pin(LED0_GPIO);
00279     delay_ms(500);
00280   }
00281 }
